==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|abageban}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*abagebaną}}; equivalent to {{prefix|de|ab|geben|t1=from|t2=give}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ˈapɡeːbn]}} * {{hyphenation|de|ab|ge|ben}} * {{audio|de|De-abgeben.ogg|audio}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=5|gibt ab|gab ab|abgegeben}} # to [[hand in]] # to [[deliver]] # to [[deposit]] #* ''[[wo|Wo]] [[kann]] [[ich]] [[mein]] [[Gepäck]] '''abgeben?''''' #*: Where can I deposit my luggage? # to [[give away]] #* (''to [[die]]'') ''den [[Löffel]] '''abgeben''''' #*: to sell the farm, to peg out, to pip out # to [[sell]] #* ''[[Kühlschrank]] ([[günstig]]) '''abzugeben''''' #*: fridge for sale (at a good price) # to [[hand over]] # to [[pass on]] # to [[concede]] # to [[emit]], [[give off]] #* ''[[Wärme]] '''abgeben''''' #*: to give off heat # {{lb|de|sports|transitive}} to [[pass]] a ball # (''shoot'') to [[fire]] #* ''einen [[Schuss]] '''abgeben''''' (compare ''[[schießen]]'') #*: to fire a shot # (''declaration'') to [[give]] #* ''eine [[Erklärung]] '''abgeben''''' #*: to issue a statement # (''vote'') to [[cast]] # (''stuff, plot, background, frame'') to [[provide]] #* ''[[Stoff]] [[für]] eine [[Komödie]] '''abgeben''''' #*: to deliver the plot for a comedy # (''to act like someone'') to [[make]] #* ''den [[Clown]] '''abgeben''''' #*: to make the clown # {{lb|de|sports|intransitive}} to [[pass]] # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[bother]] oneself with somebody/something, to [[associate]] with somebody/something, to [[mess around]] with somebody. #* ''[[damit|Damit]] '''gibt''' [[er]] [[sich]] [[nicht]] '''ab.''''' #*: He doesn't bother himself with it. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|geb|gab|gegeben|h||gib|gäb|a|a|ab}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Abgeben}} * {{l|de|Abgabe}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
